page.title: 01Paddock Wood,Five Oak Green.
page.content: Our designated area,05640144,consists of two villages which are Paddock Wood and Five Oak Green. A great deal of the land is covered by farms. Many of these farms grow food crops. These farms are Whetsted,Church,Durrants and Badsell Manor. 50% of Whetsted Farm is given to sheep farming,the other 50% is for crops.It covers an area of 174acres. Themain crop in the area used to be hops but because there is not so much demand for them now they are not so widely grown. Paddock Wood's main development centred around the railway station which was built in 1842. Today the station is largely used by commuters as it is on the main line to London. The railway also plays an important part in the Transfesa and Distribution complex.
